meanings.definition: To coat or finish with shellac.
meanings.sent1: I shellacked the wooden table to give it a shiny look.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter shellacked the chair to protect it from scratches.
meanings.sent3: After I shellacked the shelf, it looked like new!
meanings.sent4: The artist shellacked the painting, sealing its colors for years to come.
meanings.sent5: She carefully shellacked the jewelry box, making it gleam in the light.

meanings.sent1: The soccer team shellacked their opponents with a 5-0 victory.
meanings.sent2: The debate team shellacked their rivals in the final round.
meanings.sent3: The cat shellacked the mouse in every game they played together.
meanings.sent4: The superhero shellacked the villain, saving the city once again.
meanings.sent5: The student shellacked the exam, getting a perfect score.

meanings.sent1: He shellacked so much at the party that he couldn't remember anything.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends shellacked all night long during the celebration.
meanings.sent3: She shellacked at the wedding, dancing and laughing with everyone.
meanings.sent4: The birthday boy shellacked with his friends, enjoying the night to the fullest.
meanings.sent5: They shellacked at the bar, singing karaoke and having a great time.
